events.name: fetchedUUIDs
events.summary: Fired when the UUIDs of the remote device are received using SDP.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

methods.name: createSocket
methods.description: This method, when called, creates an RFCOMM Bluetooth socket ready to start an outgoing connection to the remote device using SDP lookup of UUID.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.summary: UUID of the service this socket will connect to.

parameters.name: secure
parameters.summary: Determines whether the connection will be secure or insecure.

methods.name: fetchUUIDs
methods.summary: Perform a service discovery on the remote device to get the UUIDs supported.
methods.description: The outcome of the discovery is reported via the fetchedUUIDs event.

returns.summary: Returns true if service discovery started successfully.

properties.name: address
properties.description: This property returns the Bluetooth hardware address as string. For example, "00:11:22:AA:BB:CC".

properties.name: name
properties.description: This property returns the Bluetooth name or null if there was a problem.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Possible values are DEVICE_TYPE_UNKNOWN, DEVICE_TYPE_CLASSIC, DEVICE_TYPE_DUAL and DEVICE_TYPE_LE.

properties.name: uUIDs
properties.summary: The supported UUIDs of the remote device.
properties.description: This property does not start a service discovery procedure to retrieve the UUIDs from the remote device. Rather, the local cached copy of the service UUIDs are returned. Can be null on error.
